snippet.textDisplay: I am tire of commentators talking about jlo or shakira out fits or dance.  when Cher and gaga have worn little clothing, no one has the type of comments our latin singers have had. recently last Met gala gaga strip to almost nothing there was no comment on it.  our latin culture is very sensual and by many who don’t understand it can be viewed as sexual. At 13 years old I bought myself a stiletto, in our culture we tend to put on make up at a early age dress more sensual than american kids but at the same time we know how to demand respect from others.  Not because our culture is different it should be look under a fine microscope.  Marie if your grand child wants a pole you should get her one the reason as a child,  the pole does not have the meaning adults give it.  if that’t the case children should not climb monkey bars.  At little girls pageants events and young children cheer leading squads, I see that the kids are sexualize and the comments are zero about this.  Once more attack a culture that is different than yours.

snippet.textDisplay:
I wouldn’t do any of those dances publicly. With just me and my husband, absolutely! But that’s a choice. Even when I do Zumba my kids have to be sleep or gone. No booth shaking momma cause I choose not to introduce that to them. That’s not cute or appropriate TO ME.
Now on the other hand, Shakira was doing all types of cultural dance styles. Heck in Uganda some tribal dances have women dance topless but that’s their culture so it’s not sexual to them. It’s all in the eye of the beholder. Don’t get mad at the Osmond lady. She’s white bread and always have been. That’s okay too. To each their own. That was her opinion. We don’t all have to agree. Stop putting so much energy into others opinions. Or trying to convince them to agree. It’s theirs just like you have yours.

Now I’m going to watch Shakira half again🥰
Bye👋🏽

snippet.textDisplay: Actually I found the show quite boring.  I've seen them both thrust and grind their hips before, so this was nothing new.  I wouldn't call it sexy at all.  But I would call it inappropriate for any young woman you didn't want to wind up on the pole.  These two are not the most appropriate role models.  They are both known for their bodies and not their voice.  Without her butt J-Lo is nothing.  All everyone is talking about is how great their bodies are at that age.  Not how great their music was.  But with both, you know what you are going to get.  Shaking and grinding.  Not something I would want my daughter known for.
